input.content:
# Feed & Emissions Intelligence Platform

A modern React dashboard for tracking feed production and soya content across the supply chain.

## Features

- Real-time feed tonnage tracking
- Soya product breakdown visualization
- Customer distribution analytics
- Feed company supply chain overview
- EUDR compliance monitoring
- Responsive dark theme design

## Tech Stack

- React 18
- Vite
- Tailwind CSS
- Recharts for data visualization
- Lucide React for icons

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- Node.js (v14 or higher)
- npm or yarn

### Installation

1. Clone the repository:
```bash
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/feed-emissions-dashboard.git
cd feed-emissions-dashboard
```

2. Install dependencies:
```bash
npm install
```

3. Start the development server:
```bash
npm run dev
```

The application will be available at `http://localhost:5173`

## Building for Production

```bash
npm run build
```

The build output will be in the `dist` directory.

## Deployment to Vercel

### Option 1: Deploy via Vercel CLI

1. Install Vercel CLI:
```bash
npm i -g vercel
```

2. Deploy:
```bash
vercel
```

Follow the prompts to complete deployment.

### Option 2: Deploy via GitHub Integration

1. Push your code to GitHub
2. Go to [vercel.com](https://vercel.com)
3. Click "Import Project"
4. Select your GitHub repository
5. Vercel will automatically detect Vite configuration
6. Click "Deploy"

### Environment Variables

No environment variables are required for the basic setup. If you need to add API endpoints later, create a `.env` file:

```
VITE_API_URL=your_api_url_here
```

## Project Structure

```
feed-emissions-dashboard/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Dashboard.jsx      # Main dashboard component
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ App.jsx           # App wrapper
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ main.jsx          # Entry point
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ index.css         # Tailwind CSS imports
â”œâ”€â”€ public/
â”œâ”€â”€ index.html
â”œâ”€â”€ package.json
â”œâ”€â”€ vite.config.js
â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.js
â”œâ”€â”€ postcss.config.js
â””â”€â”€ README.md
```

## License

MIT

toolUseResult.content:
# Feed & Emissions Intelligence Platform

A modern React dashboard for tracking feed production and soya content across the supply chain.

## Features

- Real-time feed tonnage tracking
- Soya product breakdown visualization
- Customer distribution analytics
- Feed company supply chain overview
- EUDR compliance monitoring
- Responsive dark theme design

## Tech Stack

- React 18
- Vite
- Tailwind CSS
- Recharts for data visualization
- Lucide React for icons

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- Node.js (v14 or higher)
- npm or yarn

### Installation

1. Clone the repository:
```bash
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/feed-emissions-dashboard.git
cd feed-emissions-dashboard
```

2. Install dependencies:
```bash
npm install
```

3. Start the development server:
```bash
npm run dev
```

The application will be available at `http://localhost:5173`

## Building for Production

```bash
npm run build
```

The build output will be in the `dist` directory.

## Deployment to Vercel

### Option 1: Deploy via Vercel CLI

1. Install Vercel CLI:
```bash
npm i -g vercel
```

2. Deploy:
```bash
vercel
```

Follow the prompts to complete deployment.

### Option 2: Deploy via GitHub Integration

1. Push your code to GitHub
2. Go to [vercel.com](https://vercel.com)
3. Click "Import Project"
4. Select your GitHub repository
5. Vercel will automatically detect Vite configuration
6. Click "Deploy"

### Environment Variables

No environment variables are required for the basic setup. If you need to add API endpoints later, create a `.env` file:

```
VITE_API_URL=your_api_url_here
```

## Project Structure

```
feed-emissions-dashboard/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Dashboard.jsx      # Main dashboard component
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ App.jsx           # App wrapper
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ main.jsx          # Entry point
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ index.css         # Tailwind CSS imports
â”œâ”€â”€ public/
â”œâ”€â”€ index.html
â”œâ”€â”€ package.json
â”œâ”€â”€ vite.config.js
â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.js
â”œâ”€â”€ postcss.config.js
â””â”€â”€ README.md
```

## License

MIT

content.text:
Your project is now ready for deployment! Here's what I've created:

âœ… **Project Structure:**
- React 18 app with Vite for fast development
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Recharts for data visualization
- Complete dashboard component with all your code

âœ… **Files Created:**
- All React components and configuration files
- `.gitignore` for Node projects
- `README.md` with deployment instructions
- Git repository initialized with initial commit

**Next Steps:**

1. **Push to GitHub:**
```bash
cd feed-emissions-dashboard
git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO_NAME.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
```

2. **Deploy to Vercel:**
   - Go to [vercel.com](https://vercel.com)
   - Click "Import Project"
   - Select your GitHub repository
   - Vercel will auto-detect Vite configuration
   - Click "Deploy"

The project will automatically build and deploy. Vercel will provide you with a live URL for your dashboard.

**Local Development:**
```bash
cd feed-emissions-dashboard
npm install
npm run dev
```
I'll help you push this to GitHub using the repository name "soy-dash". Let me create the remote repository and push the code.

input.command: cd feed-emissions-dashboard && gh repo create soy-dash --public --source=. --remote=origin --push
input.description: Create GitHub repo and push code

toolUseResult: Error: /usr/bin/bash: line 1: gh: command not found

content.text: Let me use git commands to set up the remote repository. You'll need to create the repository on GitHub first.

**Steps to complete deployment:**

1. **Create GitHub Repository:**
   - Go to [github.com/new](https://github.com/new)
   - Repository name: `soy-dash`
   - Make it public
   - Don't initialize with README (we already have one)
   - Click "Create repository"

2. **Push your code** (run these commands):
```bash
cd feed-emissions-dashboard
git remote add origin https://github.com/17871787/soy-dash.git
git push -u origin main
```

3. **Deploy to Vercel:**
   - Go to [vercel.com](https://vercel.com)
   - Click "Import Project"
   - Import from: `https://github.com/17871787/soy-dash`
   - Vercel will auto-detect Vite
   - Click "Deploy"

Your dashboard will be live in about 1-2 minutes after deployment starts!

content.text:
ðŸŽ‰ **Successfully deployed to Vercel!**

Your dashboard is now live at:
- **Production URL**: https://feed-emissions-dashboard-jz31bhx1n-joe-towers-projects.vercel.app

The deployment completed successfully with your Vite + React app. Vercel automatically:
- Detected your Vite configuration
- Installed dependencies
- Built the project
- Deployed to production

You can:
1. Visit the live URL above to see your dashboard
2. Manage the deployment at: https://vercel.com/joe-towers-projects/feed-emissions-dashboard/settings
3. Set up a custom domain if desired

The project is now connected to Vercel, so any future updates can be deployed with just `vercel` command.
